poha.q: What type of poha is best for cooking?
poha.a: Thick poha is ideal for making kanda poha or vegetable poha, while thin poha works best for light snacks.

poha.q: How to prevent poha from turning mushy?
poha.a: Do not soak poha in water for too long. Just rinse once and let it sit for 5 minutes.
Yes, you can add vegetables, peanuts, and sprouts to increase nutrition.

upma.q: Which rava is used for upma?
upma.a: Roasted semolina (suji or rava) is commonly used to make soft and fluffy upma.
Upma turns sticky if too much water is added or if it is overcooked. Maintain a 1:2 ratio of rava to water.

upma.q: How can I make upma more flavorful?
upma.a: Adding curry leaves, ginger, cashews, and vegetables enhances the taste.

samosa.q: Which flour is best for making samosa?
samosa.a: Traditionally refined flour (maida) is used, but whole wheat flour can be used for a healthier version.

samosa.q: Can samosas be baked instead of fried?
samosa.a: Yes, you can bake samosas at 180°C for 25–30 minutes until golden and crispy.

samosa.q: What is the classic samosa filling?
samosa.a: The stuffing is usually made with boiled potatoes, green peas, green chili, ginger, and spices.

dhokla.q: How can I make dhokla fluffy?
dhokla.a: Adding ENO or baking soda to the batter makes dhokla soft and spongy.

dhokla.q: How long should dhokla be steamed?
dhokla.a: It usually takes 15–20 minutes on medium flame to steam dhokla properly.
A tempering of mustard seeds, curry leaves, green chilies, and sugar water adds extra flavor.

paneer.q: What type of paneer is best for butter masala?
paneer.a: Fresh, soft paneer works best for a creamy paneer butter masala.

paneer.q: How to make paneer butter masala creamy?
paneer.a: Use cashew paste and fresh cream for a rich, creamy gravy.

paneer.q: Can paneer butter masala be made vegan?
paneer.a: Yes, substitute paneer with tofu and cream with coconut cream or cashew cream.

dal.q: Which dal is best for dal fry?
dal.a: Toor dal (pigeon peas) is most commonly used, but moong dal or masoor dal can also be used.

dal.q: How to make dal fry more flavorful?
dal.a: A ghee-based tempering with garlic, cumin, and red chili enhances the flavor.

dal.q: Can dal fry be made without onion and garlic?
dal.a: Yes, you can skip onion and garlic for a satvik version of dal fry.

gulab-jamun.q: Why do gulab jamuns break while frying?
gulab-jamun.a: Too much moisture in the dough or frying at very high heat can cause them to break.

gulab-jamun.q: How to make gulab jamuns soft?
gulab-jamun.a: Knead the dough gently and soak them in warm sugar syrup immediately after frying.

gulab-jamun.q: Can gulab jamun be made without khoya?
gulab-jamun.a: Yes, milk powder is a good alternative for making gulab jamun.

rasgulla.a: If the chenna is kneaded too much or boiled at high flame, rasgullas turn hard.

rasgulla.q: How to make rasgullas soft and spongy?
rasgulla.a: Knead chenna until smooth and cook in boiling sugar syrup at medium heat.
Yes, cardamom, saffron, or rose water can be added for extra flavor.

mango-shake.q: Which mango is best for mango shake?
mango-shake.a: Alphonso, Kesar, or any sweet ripe mango works best.

mango-shake.q: How to make mango shake creamy?
mango-shake.a: Blend mango pulp with chilled milk and a scoop of ice cream for extra creaminess.

mango-shake.q: Can I make mango shake without sugar?
mango-shake.a: Yes, if the mangoes are sweet, sugar is not required. Honey can also be used.

chai.q: What spices are used in masala chai?
chai.a: Common spices include ginger, cardamom, cinnamon, cloves, and black pepper.

chai.q: What is the ideal milk-to-water ratio for chai?
chai.a: A 2:1 ratio of milk to water is considered perfect for masala chai.

chai.q: When is the best time to drink masala chai?
chai.a: It is best enjoyed in the morning or evening but should be avoided right after meals.

sabudana.q: How to prevent sabudana khichdi from becoming sticky?
sabudana.a: Soak sabudana for 5–6 hours and drain excess water before cooking.

sabudana.q: Which potatoes are best for sabudana khichdi?
sabudana.a: Starchy potatoes work best as they blend well with sabudana pearls.

sabudana.q: Can sabudana khichdi be eaten daily?
sabudana.a: It is usually eaten during fasting but can also be enjoyed as a light breakfast or snack.

rajgira.q: How to make rajgira paratha soft?
rajgira.a: Mix rajgira flour with boiled potatoes to bind the dough and make soft parathas.

rajgira.q: What can be served with rajgira paratha?
rajgira.a: It tastes best with curd, aloo sabzi, or peanut chutney.
